quiz.text: If after drawing his whole amount of money, R invested 32.5% of this amount in the compound interest for 3 years at rate of interest per annum of 12.5% and the remaining amount of the money he kept with him. Then find the total amount of money with him after 3 years?(approx.)

quiz.text: If a new person U deposits three-fourth of the money invested by Q, for 4 more years than T, then find his rate of interest, if simple interest obtained by him is same as simple interest obtained by R in the scheme.

16%

quiz.text: If the ratio of the amount of money obtained by Q to that of T is in the ratio of x : y respectively. Then find the rate of interest obtained by the person T.
options: 18.3%

quiz.text: Sameer invested Rs. ‘K’ in scheme X which offers _____ % rate of simple interest for 3 years and investment in Scheme Y is Rs. 9000  less than scheme X that offers _____ % rate of simple interest for 4 years. Total interest earned by Sameer from both the schemes is Rs. 34200. If Sameer invested Rs. (2K – 9000) in scheme Z for two years at 10% per annum simple interest, then interest earned from Scheme Z is Rs. 9000. Which of the following statement(s) is/are satisfy the blanks in same order?   I). 28%, 16% II). 88/3%, 12% III). 220/9%, 20% IV). 30%, 14%
options: I and III only
III and IV only
II, III, IV only
All satisfy the blanks
None of the above

quiz.text: P lent Rs. ___ to Q at ___% rate of simple interest for 2 years and received Rs.600 as interest. After two years, P lends the whole amount which he received from Q to R at a rate of 10% simple interest for 2 years and interest received from Q is Rs.180 more than the interest received from R. Which two values can be filled in the blanks in the same order?
options: 1200, 15
1500, 10
3000, 10
1500, 20
2000, 15

800
900
1000

quiz.text: Ramya borrowed Rs.r from Krishna at the rate of 13% simple interest and Rs.2r from Mohana at the rate of 26 % simple interest she then added Rs. 82500 with the total amount she borrowed from Krishna and Mohana together and lend it to Soha at the rate of 10% simple interest. The total profit, she received at the end of one year in this process was Rs. 1725. (approx. value of r)
options: 17632.85
16542.85
16782.85
18678.85
18642.85

quiz.text: Aman took a loan of amount Rs. 6000 from the bank at 5% per annum at SI. He pays the amount in 4 instalments out of which first three instalments are 1/4th of the principal amount and the rest amount is paid in last installment. Amount paid by Aman in the last instalment is Rs _______.
options: Rs 2250
Rs 1750
Rs 2500
Rs 2750
Rs 2000

quiz.text: Quantity A - Find the sum given at 8%. A part of 16000 is given at 8% and another at 12% for 3 years under simple interest. The total interest after 3 years is Rs.4680. Quantity B - Amount if Rs.8000 is invested at double the rate for 1 year. Amount invested under simple interest doubles itself in 16 years.
options: Quantity A≥ Quantity B
Quantity A≤ Quantity B
Quantity A< Quantity B
Quantity A> Quantity B
Quantity A= Quantity B or No relation

quiz.text: Quantity I: Peter invested Rs. P in a scheme A offering simple interest at 12% per annum for five years. He invested the whole amount he received from scheme A in another scheme B offering simple interest at 5% per annum for 4 years, if the difference between the interests earned from scheme A and B was Rs. 2240. What is the value of P?  Quantity II: Mohan deposited Rs. 12000 at simple interest which amounted to Rs. 16800 after 4 years. Had the interest been 5% more, how much amount he would have got?  Quantity III: The SI on certain sum of money for 18 months at the rate of 8% per annum exceeds the SI on the same sum at 10% per annum for 12 months by Rs. 200. Then find the sum?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I > Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I = Quantity II = Quantity III

quiz.text: Quantity I: Rajeev bought a bike priced at Rs. 80,000 after a cash down payment of Rs. 41,000 and 12 equal monthly instalments of Rs. x each. He paid a total of Rs. 1,01,000, what is the annual rate of simple interest?   Quantity II: A bike is sold for Rs. 60,000 cash or Rs. 30,000 cash down payment followed by Rs. 33,600 after a month. What is the annual rate of simple interest?   What is 120% of Quantity I ÷ Quantity II?
options: 1.221
2.132
3.33
4.225
5.555

quiz.text: Quantity A - Find the sum given at 12%. A part of 16000 is given at 8% and other at 12% for 3 years under simple interest. Total interest after 3 years is Rs. 4680.   Quantity B - Amount if Rs. 8000 is invested at double the rate for 2 year. Amount invested under simple interest doubles itself in 16 years.
options: Quantity A ≥ Quantity B
Quantity A ≤ Quantity B
Quantity A = Quantity B or no relationship can be established
Quantity A > Quantity B
Quantity A < Quantity B

quiz.text: Given below are two quantities named A and B. Based on the given information, you have to determine the relationship between the two quantities. You should use the given data and your knowledge of Mathematics to choose between the possible answers.   Quantity A: A person invested a total of Rs 58000 in three parts at 8%, 9%, and 6% per annum on simple interest. At the end of a year, he received equal interest in all three cases. the amount invested at 6% is.     Quantity B: Rs 24000
options: Quantity A > Quantity B
Quantity A < Quantity B
Quantity A ≥ Quantity B
Quantity A ≤ Quantity B
Quantity A = Quantity B or No relation

quiz.text: How much did Rohit borrowed?  I) Rohit borrowed a sum at 10% per annum simple interest from Rakesh. He returns the amount after 5 years. II) Rakesh return 5% of the total amount received if he received Rs. 240 as interest.
options: The statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, but the statement II alone is not sufficient.
Both the statements I and II together are needed to answer the question.
The statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, but the statement I alone is not sufficient.
Either statement I alone or statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
Neither statement I nor statement II is sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text: Find the total amount paid by the person to the bank.   Statement I:  A person took the loan of Rs. 7000 from the bank at rate of 5% per annum simple interest. Statement II:  He wants to repay the loan in 5 years in some installments. Statement III∶ At the end of 3 years, he paid Rs. 3000 and cleared the dues after 2 more years.
options: All the statements are required to answer the question.
Any two statements are sufficient to answer the question.
Either statement I or II and statement III are required to answer the question.
Statement I and III together are sufficient to answer the question.
Statement II and III together are sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text: Find the rate of simple interest per annum.   Statement I. Silky borrowed Rs. 18,000 from Nimi for 2 years on simple interest. Statement II. Silky returned Rs. 23,400 to Nimi at the end of 2 years and settled the loan. Statement III. A sum of money becomes triple in 40/3 years on simple interest.
options: The data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II and III alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I and III alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement I and II together or in statement III is sufficient to answer the question.
The data in all the statements I, II, and III are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in all statements I, II, and III together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text: Rahul wants to invest Rs.4, 000 in two EduTap package RBI grade B course and SBI PO course. He invests 10% p.a. at simple interest on RBI grade B course and Remaining at 15% p.a. at simple interest. What is the time period T of his investment?   I. The ratio of interest of the course RBI grade B course and SBI PO course are in the ratio of 1 ∶ 6 II. Rahul invests 2,500 in SBI PO course.
options: The statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, but the statement II alone is not sufficient.
The statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, but the statement I alone is not sufficient.
Both the statements I and II together are needed to answer the question.
Either statement I alone or statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
Neither statement I nor statement II is sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text: Dheeraj deposited his money in two banks namely P and Q. He invested some amount in Bank P for “N” years and the rest of the amount in Bank Q for “N + 6” years at the different simple rates of interest. How much money did he deposit in Bank P?   Statement I: He gets a combined interest of Rs. 16,000 from both the banks. Statement II: The rates of interest provided by Bank P and Bank Q are 8% and 6% respectively. Statement III: He deposited the same amount in both the banks.
options: Statement I and Statement II together are sufficient but no other pair of statements is sufficient.
Statement II and Statement III together are sufficient but no other pair of statements is sufficient.
Statement I and Statement III together are sufficient but no other pair of statements is sufficient.
All three statements together are necessary.
All three statements together are not sufficient.

quiz.text: P invested a certain amount of money on simple interest at the rate of interest 20% per annum for 3 years. Q invested some amount on the simple interest at the rate of interest 15% for 3 years. The sum of interests of P and Q after 3 years will be Rs. 6600 and the amount invested by P is Rs. 3000 less than the amount invested by Q. Find the total amount invested by P and Q together
options: Rs. 10000
Rs. 11000
Rs. 12000
Rs. 13000
Rs. 18000

Then find the amount paid by ram in the last installment.

quiz.text: Sumit borrowed Rs. 33,000 which has to be paid in three equal installments at simple interest. Calculate the value of annual installment if the rate of interest is 10% per annum.

Rs 10,000

quiz.text: The Cost Price of a Yamaha Bike is Rs.75000. Rahul intends to buy the bike. But he doesn't have the complete budget to purchase it at once. So the dealer presents a new scheme, where Rahul can pay a down payment of Rs.15000 initially, and pay the remaining amount in monthly instalments of Rs.2000, for a period of two and a half years. But the condition is that he will need to pay an annual additional Simple Interest of 20% for each year. How much amount does Rahul need to pay eventually for the bike?
options: Rs 1, 05,000
Rs 99,000
Rs 95,000
Rs 12,500
Rs 1, 10,000

quiz.text: In what ratio a sum of Rs. 48,000 should be invested in two schemes with return of 12% p.a. and 15% p.a. each for two years at simple interest such that the total interest obtained is Rs. 12,480?
options: 2: 5
3: 4
2: 1
3: 8
